values:
Since, I haven't posted in this one in almost a year and I've had it since I was fourteen or fifteen, I decided to make a new one.


lilyofvalleys

I haven't posted in a long time and I thought I wouldn't ever again, but I'm kind of down.

As of now, my dad's out of job.  That means I can't go to college right now.  My parents have no money in the bank.  I'm working a full time job in order to save to go to community college where ever I end up living and I'm applying to get a weekend job just in case my mom needs  back surgery even worse than she does now.

I had to take care of her all weekend because her back went out and my dad is completely oblivious. lol.  

I just feel alone. . .again.   I haven't really been truly happy in over two years.  I've just been trying to get by, slide to the next step.  

I have no other step.  I feel like it may be falling apart.  


I hope everything turns out okay.  


I kind of want to run away, now.  I want to join the circus for a while.

I lied.  I am looking for a lover. Lovers are liars, but I don't care. :[
Some people are telling that I look like this chick. [Regina Spektor] Do I look like a Russian? lol

About six days until I move to Memphis.  I'm very excited. :]   Plus, KT is going to visit me, then Joe is visiting me. :]


I am painting Marilyn Monroe for art class.  This is the hardest project that I have ever done.  Srsly.  It is so detailed, but I am mucho proud of it. 




P.S.  I kill little girls.

So, Anyway. . . I bought Cursive:The Ugly Organ last weekend. It's pretty much the best thing ever. I love the mix of so many instruments in a dark way. As in, the organ is played in a creepy manner as opposed to a melodic way. I love it. ♥ It's kind of one of those albums that you listen to when you are pissed or something. Anyway, some of you know that Joe and I are starting a band. Just Another Hero We haven't recorded anything, but during Christmas, Joe is coming to visit me in Memphis and we are going to record some stuff on my computer. I've just been filled with emotion for the past six months, so I've already written plenty of songs. Here's a secret: I am terrified of starting over, again. Moving. Memphis. Dating. Graduation/School.

Damn everyone!   It doesn't snow in Louisiana!


:[[[

I'm moving to Memphis. Well, hopefully, I will be starting the greatest chapter in my life. The last six months have been the hardest that I can remember ever having. I can't wait to forget that I ever had it. I've changed so much. I really hope that I can erase this time and start so fresh that I will look back and laugh hysterically. I am Elvis. Jack White. I wouldn't mind marrying this man, as I admire him dearly.
Those three words. I've said too much. It's not enough.
Yeah.  There is a catch.  You have a girlfriend.
How is it possible that you are so perfect? You can't be real.

I have possibly three dates this weekend.

Alright, I have had three boyfriends this year.  Let me give you one sentence for how they are now.

Boyfriend #1: Hits on me more than he did when we dated.

Boyfriend #2: Tells me that he bought condoms and thought of me.

Boyfriend #3: Won't talk to me, but I seem to remember a guy who wanted to tattoo my inner thighs.

All I have to say about this is WTF?  

It <strike>kind of</strike> pisses me off. 
ALL OF IT.

I'd just like to say that I <strike>like</strike> LOVE Head Automatica.


Thank you.

Goodnight.

<3

Why am I always the one who gets fucked over?  It's not fair.  Yes, I am talking to you.

With a sad heart I say bye to you and wave, kicking shadows on the street for every mistake that I made.  Then, I fell down crying "Make it go away!"  Just make your smile come back and shine just like used to be.  Then, I whispered, "How could you do this to me?"

Is it just not possible for a person to be friends with their ex no matter how hard they try?  OR does it just take time for the two to get completely over each other in order to be friends?  I really don't know.  It just seems like I am always the one getting hurt.


"I need to do this for myself."

I dated Jesse for about a month, right? AND I didn't write a LJ entry about him? I write one about Joe, why not Jesse? I liked Jesse a kazillion times more! <3 Anyway...would you like for me to make up for lost time? Well...This is the best I can do. Jesse made me feel so good/happy. He made me feel things that I have never felt before. BUT anyway, I can't go back so I am moving on although in the process, I am missing him. I need some lovin' right now.

ummm....So I totally got my ears pierced, again, like 6 hours ago.  I got a second hole.  Now, I can say that I have four piercings.  wooo.  Ilikeitalot.


BY THE WAY!  I <3 JIM GAFFIGIN!

DOES ANYONE WANT TO HANG WITH ME BEFORE I LEAVE?

ONE LAST HOOOOOOOO-------RAAAAHHHHH!


CALL ME or MESSAGE ME!

Have you missed me?  I think...not?  Well...What to say?  *thinks* *looks around*  Well...I have been soooooooo busy with hanging out with KT and Jesse, cleaning my house and going through stuff.  Not to mention the minor details.  "I want a Sunday kind of love."

Anyway...How's your mom?


SOY TU PAPA!

Ok....all the relationships I have in Middlesboro, although I have learned things from them...I wish I had never known these guys.  It may sound bad, but part of me feels like I would be better off without knowing ANY of them...They were fun while they lasted, but...bleh! Despite the knowledge...I just don't know...!
WHO WANTS TO GO TO THE MALL WITH ME TOMORROW...OR TODAY...?...I AM SINGLE...HAHA..*WINK*...AND BLEH! call me @ ~499-3192~
Ok...so Joe and I broke up, but luckily I am not too sad about it. It was mutual.  I don't want to go into gory details, though.  (they aren't really gory)...lol

KT, Jordy and I went walking to the book fair today and my feet started sweating..haha...and now I have a blister. UGh!  


OH YEAH!!! The book that I bought for 25cents was "Mars and Venus on a Date".  IT is awesome.  Although I am not single, it is pretty cool to read.  On the back over it says "You don't have to be single forever"...hahah

I need love...ppl need to ask me to do something with them..




GIVE ME LOVE!!

I was bending down today to get my books after school and my hair was all in my face. Joe leaned down and kissed me through my hair.  It was funny/cute/odd and I liked it.:P


haha

Yesterday, I went to see Relient K...

        We left at about 12.30 to 1 o'clock in the afternoon.  We (my mom and I) picked up Caroline and then headed on our quest to see Relient k in Louisville, KY! When we finally finished our trip at about 4:15, we looked for Jillian's Louisville, sports bar.  We found it and then drove around to find somewhere to eat, but couldn't find anywhere.  I finally said "why don't we eat at Jillian's?"  When we went in, there were already about 30-40 people lined up waiting to go in and it didn't even start until 7:00.  

        We went in to eat and I was too excited to eat anything, so I made Caroline hurry and finish so we could go wait outside.  By the time we got out there there were another 50-60 people waitng.  IT WAS FREEZY COLD OUTSIDE!!!!  (I had an extra ticket and I scalped it...wooo...i am such a rebel.)

        The doors were supposed to open at 6:00, but didn't open until 7:30.  THat means that we waited outside for about 2-2 1/2 hours!  After we got in, we thought there would be seats.  We were surprised.  It was all festival seating.  People packed into this 30x30 room (not including the stage).  There ended up being 1000-1500 people packed into this room.  We were all body to body.  

        Luckily, Caroline and I got within 10 feet of the stage.  We were waiting another 20 minutes after we actually got in there.  So the concert didn't start until about 8:15.  Caroline and I, being 5'4'' HAD to get behind these guys who were like 6'4''!  We had to find these window of heads during the whole concert.

        House of Heroes started the concert.  They were so good.  THey incorporated "Fat Bottomed Girls" by Queen into the beginning and end of their set.  I have to say that was pretty "schweet!"  

        Maxeen played next.  Out of all of the warm up bands, they were my favorite.  I swear the lead singer was Elijah Wood in cognito, he was really hot, though.  When they came on, everyone started mosh pitting, but the security guards stopped them. That didn't stop anyone from trying it anyway, as in, they tried like 15 times!  People were picking other people up over their heads and pushing them to the front, but yet again the security guards took them away.  

       It was so freakin' hot in there that this girl in front of us fainted.  People were sweating like pigs in there.  Caroline was like "I smell!" and so I said "Do I smell?" I lifted up my arm and she smelled my armpit, it was awesome.  

       The Rocket Summer came on and all I have to say is...."WHATEVA!"

       Finally, the moment we had been waiting for, Relient K was up.  People were chanting their name.  It was like a movie.  It was called the Matthew Hoopes Birthday tour, so they obviously started out with an odd rendition of "Happy Birthday".  It started out all sweet and then became all hip-hoppy, it was hilarious.  They came on and everyone went crazy!  They were singing to all of the songs.  When "Fallin' in love with the 80s" began I called Jesse, held for about a minute, then hung up.  He called back. It was funny.  

      AFterwards, We filed out and bought t-shirts.  We thought Relient K would have a signing, but found out they weren't. We were sad!  This is how we found out.  Some people from the other bands were signing autographs and taking pictures.  MY MOM ASKED THE LEAD SINGER OF THE ROCKET SUMMER IF RELIENT K WERE GOING TO SIGN AUTOGRAPHS!  How hilarious is that?  He was trying to take picture with someone else and it was just so perfect.  MY mom is totally hardcore. Caroline got her picture with House of Heroes.  I wanted my picture with Maxeen, but the lead singer wasn't out there.  

     We left to go to the hotel and that was that.

     Basically, it was a bunch of sweaty, hormonal, teenagers with loud music.  It was so fun.  I have never done anything like that at all.  I love it!

     We came, we saw, we conquered! 



P.S. I will post pictures later!
